column5: Can you use a USA marine radio in Canada? Any special instructions in using the USA marine radio in Canada?
They work fine, just make sure to end you communication with "eh"...
Marine radios work by point to point contact. There are no repeaters or towers. As long as you have a decent anntenae you will be fine.
We all have the 10' Shakespeare Antennas. I'm new to marine radios, but I have been told those are good antennas.

We use them every year between two boats. There has been times we've talked 15+ miles apart. We have 8 foot antennas installed. Just a good piece of equipment for safety and communications. We leave them on the emergency channel and if we want to talk make a switch to a predetermined channel between us.
How did we all know that was coming?
Sometimes the channels are different than in the US. http://www.ccg-gcc.gc.ca/eng/Mcts/vhf
